chapter.title: Features
chapter.para:
JGlideMon's core features list includes:
Screenshots
Auto-refresh Auto-scaling Shrinking/restoring/hiding of the WoW window
Reading chat logs
Receives chat in real-time Colored like in WoW Organized by channel, public, whisper, guild, etc. JGlideMon can also parse Glider log files
Sending chat
Can send whispers, replies, guild, say, and raw Quick whispering by double clicking on a chat entry JGlideMon pauses Glider, which results in reliable chat
Sending mouse clicks/key strokes
From the screenshot tab, you can press keys and click the mouse and it will be sent to Glider This allows for limited control when you are away from the computer
Tracking followers
Loading profiles
Charting health and mana over time
Tracking mobs, reputation, and skills
Tracks mob names, average XP, and number killed Tracks reputation gained with what faction Tracks skill increases
Tracking gold and loot
All looted items are organized by quality into tables The median AH price or vendor price (configurable) of each item is downloaded from Allakhazam and used to estimate gold earned per hour Clicking an item will open a user-selectable web page, i.e. Thottbot, Allakhazam, or Wowhead
Support for multiple Gliders
You only need to run one instance of JGlideMon in order to be able to monitor several Gliders Popup alerts help distinguish which Glider connection needs your attention

Optional features include:
Text-to-Speech
JGlideMon can speak what someone whispers you
